alert.note: Alert for Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 09 at 1:28AM CDT until May 09 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CAMERON COUNTY... At 127 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Boca Chica Beach, or 9 miles east of Port Of Brownsville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Wind sensor at NWS Brownsville gusted to 69 mph as storm passed. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Los Fresnos, South Padre Island, Rancho Viejo, Southmost, Olmito, Port Of Brownsville, Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Brownsville and Lincoln Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
